title: First Week in Martinborough: Town Square, Wine Streets & Good Eats
excerpt: A few days into settling in Martinborough and I'm noticing the quirky details of this wine town.
content:
The town center here is built around a square which gives it a different feel than Auckland. All the street names reference other countries and cities - Venice Street, Dublin Street, etc. Kind of a mini world map in wine country.

The new fancy housing development is actually called "Pinot Place" which made me laugh. This town really loves its wine!

Had some good meals at local spots:

  • Luna - Good service and nice wine selection. Need to try their special Pinot.
  • Tohi - Gin bar with tasty Asian kitchen food.
  • Na Ra - Delicious chicken and waffles!

The pace is definitely slower here. People take time to chat, and everyone seems to know each other. Planning to spend the next week or 2 just unwinding, getting a car, exploring around the Wairarapa and maybe into Wellington city.
